title: The Final Cut

setting.location: Malhotra Studios, Mumbai, India - specifically the luxurious top floor office
setting.atmosphere: Glamorous yet tense, mixing the glittering world of Bollywood with dark secrets

premise: During the wrap party of his latest film, renowned producer Raj Malhotra is found dead in his office, which was locked from inside. The murder weapon is his own Filmfare Award trophy, and five people had access to his office that evening. Hours before, Raj had threatened to expose a devastating secret about one of them.
actualEvents: 7:00 PM - Wrap party begins in the main studio hall
8:15 PM - Raj receives an urgent phone call and heads to his office
8:30 PM - Priya visits Raj to discuss their marriage
8:45 PM - Arjun delivers documents to Raj's office
9:00 PM - Vikram confronts Raj about the company finances
9:20 PM - Meera meets Raj to discuss her contract
9:35 PM - Kabir enters to pitch his new film
9:50 PM - Kabir murders Raj with the trophy
10:00 PM - Kabir exits through the window, using the scaffold outside to return to the party
10:30 PM - Body is discovered when Arjun brings investors to meet Raj

solution.method: Used the scaffold outside the window to re-enter after leaving through the door, making it appear locked from inside
solution.motive: Raj discovered Kabir had been selling company scripts to rival studios
solution.explanation: Kabir had been secretly selling Malhotra Studios' scripts to competing production houses, explaining why his last three films flopped - they were already leaked. When Raj discovered this betrayal, he threatened to expose Kabir, which would have ended his career and likely led to criminal charges. Kabir used his knowledge of the building's renovation scaffold to stage a locked-room murder, making it appear impossible for anyone to have entered or left.

redHerrings: Love letters between Raj and Meera found in his desk
Priya's recently updated life insurance policy on Raj
Arjun's secret recordings of Raj's meetings
A divorce petition draft found in Raj's personal files
